definition: historical biography
to arrange/to line up/file/series/(in data tables) column/(Tw) row
to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)
biography/historical narrative/commentaries/relay station
The Sing-Song Girls of Shanghai by Han Bangqing 韓邦慶|韩邦庆[Han2 Bang1 qing4], long novel of lower life in Classical Chinese and Jiangsu vernacular/translated into Putonghua as 海上花 by Iris Chang
Biographic History of Qing Dynasty by a succession of authors, published 1928 and revised 1987, with biographies of 2,900 notable Qing commoner citizens, 80 scrolls

sentences.english: Inthe Biographies in the Qing Dynasty, although there are many advantages, there are many errors.
sentences.chinese: 《清史列传》虽存在许多优点，而错误亦存不少。

sentences.english: It is mistaken to define the writer of the manuscript entitled Biographies of the History of the Ming Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 抄本《明史列传》的撰者被定为徐干学是错误的。

sentences.english: Is her experience and knowledge sufficient for biography writing?
sentences.chinese: 她对我的领会足够可以写我的列传吗？

sentences.english: "The Biographies of the Merciless Officials" presents us with the merciless officials' success and failure in their life.
sentences.chinese: 《酷吏列传》为我们展现了西汉时期酷吏的成败人生。

sentences.english: Better to learn history realistically by reading biographies rather than textbooks.
sentences.chinese: 实际地学历史可读列传而非教科书。

sentences.english: Experience of fierce general biographies is rich and generous, still can cooperate " end knife " piece multiple award.
sentences.chinese: 武将列传经验丰厚，还能配合“尾刀”出多倍奖励。

definition: biographic sketch of an emperor
the 24 or 25 official dynastic histories/true history, as opposed to fictional adaptation or popular legends
historical biography

Draft History of the Qing Dynasty, sometimes listed as number 25 or 26 of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Zhao Erxun 趙爾巽|赵尔巽[Zhao4 Er3 xun4] in 1927 during the Northern Warlords period, 536 scrolls
history genre based on biography, such as Sima Qian's Record of the Historian

History of the Song Dynasty, twentieth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], composed under Toktoghan 脫脫|脱脱[Tuo1 tuo1] in 1345 during the Yuan Dynasty 元[Yuan2], 496 scrolls/(not to be confused with 宋書|宋书[Song4 shu1])

History of Eastern Han (later Han), third of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], composed by Fan Ye 范曄|范晔[Fan4 Ye4] in 445 during Song of the Southern Dynasties 南朝宋[Nan2 chao2 Song4], 120 scrolls
Records of the Grand Historian, by 司馬遷|司马迁[Si1 ma3 Qian1], first of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3]
chronicle (of sb's life)
twenty four dynastic histories (or 25 or 26 in modern editions)
sketch biography/profile
history book

A Mirror for the Wise Ruler (or Comprehensive Mirror for Aid in Government), a vast chronological general history, written by 司馬光|司马光[Si1 ma3 Guang1] Sima Guang (1019-1089) and collaborators during the Northern Song in 1084, covering the period 403 BC-959 AD, 294 scrolls

History of the Later Tang Dynasty, seventeenth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Ouyang Xiu 歐陽修|欧阳修[Ou1 yang2 Xiu1] and Song Qi 宋祁[Song4 Qi2] in 1060 during Northern Song 北宋[Bei3 Song4], 225 scrolls
History of the Former Han Dynasty, second of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], composed by Ban Gu 班固[Ban1 Gu4] in 82 during Eastern Han (later Han), 100 scrolls
History of the Sui Dynasty, thirteenth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Wei Zheng 魏徵|魏征[Wei4 Zheng1] in 636 during Tang Dynasty, 85 scrolls
